National Interoperability Information Exchange
National Interoperability
Information Exchange

Welcome to the National Interoperability Information eXchange
Welcome to the National Interoperability Information eXchange

• The National Public Safety Telecommunications Council (NPSTC), at
• The National Public Safety Telecommunications Council (NPSTC), at

the request of several Statewide Interoperability Planning Committees, is offering a service (www.NIIX.org) that includes tools to assist states with the development of their statewide communications interoperability plans.
the request of several Statewide Interoperability Planning
Committees, is offering a service (www.NIIX.org) that includes tools to C o m m i t t e e s ,

assist states with the development of their statewide communications
interoperability plans.

• NIIX is a free service that acts as a centralized clearinghouse for
• NIIX is a free service that acts as a centralized clearinghouse for

interoperable communications-related information. Interoperability planning committee members can access peer-created documents and share information with each other. NIIX represents a collaborative effort of local, tribal, state, and regional organizations to share statewide plans, agreements, policy documents and other related information through a web-based, secure location.
interoperable communications-related information. Interoperability
planning committee members can access peer-created documents
and share information with each other. NIIX represents a
collaborative effort of local, tribal, state, and regional organizations to
share statewide plans, agreements, policy documents and other
related information through a web-based, secure location.

NIIX Services • Centralized access to peer-supplied documents,
NIIX Services
• Centralized access to peer-supplied documents,

including various plans, agreements, governance, policy, legislation, SOPs, funding and other useful documents
including various plans, agreements, governance,
policy, legislation, SOPs, funding and other useful
documents

• Ability for members to submit documents to a national
• Ability for members to submit documents to a national

library for sharing with peers
library for sharing with peers

• Security and authentication ensures that only members with appropriate authorization have access to sensitive planning documents
• Security and authentication ensures that only members
with appropriate authorization have access to sensitive
planning documents

NIIX Services Continued
NIIX Services Continued

• Collaborative section will allow Statewide/regional
• Collaborative section will allow Statewide/regional

administrators to access state/regional sub- communities, with the ability to securely manage and share draft documents, solicit comments, and manage member notification and feedback (note this functionality will available the first week of August, 2007)
administrators to access state/regional sub-
communities, with the ability to securely manage and
share draft documents, solicit comments, and manage
member notification and feedback (note this
functionality will available the first week of August,
2007)

NIIX Registration Form
NIIX Registration Form

Complete the following information and press submit to become an authorized user of NIIX. Remember to check the Terms of Service Box.
Complete the following
information and press
submit to become an
authorized user of
NIIX. Remember to
check the Terms of
Service Box.

You will be emailed a confirmation with your user id and password.
You will be emailed a
confirmation with your
user id and password.

Registration Continued
Registration Continued

You create your own user ID and password. Your ID can be up to 30 characters long.
You create your own user
ID and password. Your ID
can be up to 30 characters
long.

Your password must be at least 8 characters long, with at least one character each from 3 of the following 4 types: upper case letters, lower case letters, numbers, and/or special characters.
Your password must be at
least 8 characters long,
with at least one character
each from 3 of the
following 4 types: upper
case letters, lower case
letters, numbers, and/or
special characters.

NIIX Main Page
NIIX Main Page

Once logged on, the display allows a registered user to select either:
Once logged on, the display
allows a registered user to
select either:

• Recent Documents through the link provided at the top of the left hand column
• Recent Documents • R e c e n t
D o c u m e n t s
through the link provided at
the top of the left hand
column

• Selected documents by topic from the pick list links in the left hand column
• Selected documents by • S e l e c t e d
d o c u m e n t s
b y
topic from the pick list
links in the left hand
column

• All public documents for a state by clicking on that particular state.

p u b l i c
d o c u m e n t s

Document Page
Document Page

When all documents for a state are selected, this page appears.
When all documents for a
state are selected, this page
appears.

Any blue/underlined field in the heading can be used for sorting.
Any blue/underlined field in
the heading can be used for
sorting.

Any blue/underlined field in an entry can be used for added information:
Any blue/underlined field in
an entry can be used for
added information:

• Description provides a document synopsis
• Description provides a • D e s c r i p t i o n
p r o v i d e s
a
document synopsis

• Table of Contents displays the documents Table of Contents, if available.

o f

d i s p l a y s
the documents Table of
Contents, if available.

Member Listing
Member Listing

Clicking on the “Member” button at the top center of the log-in page and then selecting a state displays this page.
Clicking on the
“Member” button at the
top center of the log-in
page and then selecting a
state displays this page.

Clicking on a member’s name will provide contact information for that member.
Clicking on a member’s
name will provide
contact information for
that member.

Clicking on a member’s email address will queue that address into your email program to send a message to that member.
Clicking on a member’s
email address will queue
that address into your
email program to send a
message to that member.
